page.title: 10OLD KIRK
page.content: There has been a church on the site since before 1200. The oldest grave in the churchyard is 1000 years old. The present Kirk was built in 1807 but, in 1968 it had to be completely renovated except for the lower church which is 141 years old and is 100 feet high. It was built by the monks from Dunfermline Abbey. In the church there are 14 stained glass windows altogether. In the tower there is one bell which has ben renewed three times - the last time was in 1707. There was once a church school in the church where Robert Adam, the architect and his brother were taught by Thomas Carlyle. Many important people have been christened in the Kirk, including Sir Michael Nairn, who invented linoleum and Sir Sandford Fleming, the famous engineer.
